001package squidpony.squidmath;
002
003import squidpony.annotation.Beta;
004
005/**
006 * Just another experiment with precomputed point hashes. Nothing too useful here yet.
007 */
008@Beta
009public class TabularPointHash extends IPointHash.IntImpl {
010    private final int[] table;
011    private final FourWheelRNG random;
012    public TabularPointHash() {
013        this(42);
014    }
015
016    public TabularPointHash(int state) {
017        super(state);
018        table = new int[0x20000];
019        random = new FourWheelRNG(state);
020        for (int i = 0; i < table.length; i++) {
021            long r = random.nextLong();
022            table[i] = (int) r;
023            table[++i] = (int) (r >>> 32);
024        }
025    }
026
027    @Override
028    public void setState(int state) {
029        super.setState(state);
030        random.setSeed(state);
031        for (int i = 0; i < table.length; i++) {
032            long r = random.nextLong();
033            table[i] = (int) r;
034            table[++i] = (int) (r >>> 32);
035        }
036    }
037
038    @Override
039    public void setState(long state) {
040        super.setState(state);
041        random.setSeed(state);
042        for (int i = 0; i < table.length; i++) {
043            long r = random.nextLong();
044            table[i] = (int) r;
045            table[++i] = (int) (r >>> 32);
046        }
047    }
048
049    @Override
050    public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int state) {
051        return table[table[x + state & 0x1FFFF] + y & 0x1FFFF] ^ state;
052    }
053
054    @Override
055    public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int state) {
056        return table[table[table[x + state & 0x1FFFF] + y & 0x1FFFF] + z & 0x1FFFF] ^ state;
057    }
058
059    @Override
060    public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int state) {
061        return table[table[table[table[x + state & 0x1FFFF] + y & 0x1FFFF] + z & 0x1FFFF] + w & 0x1FFFF] ^ state;
062    }
063
064    @Override
065    public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int state) {
066        return table[table[table[table[table[x + state & 0x1FFFF] + y & 0x1FFFF] + z & 0x1FFFF] + w & 0x1FFFF] + u & 0x1FFFF] ^ state;
067    }
068
069    @Override
070    public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v, int state) {
071        return table[table[table[table[table[table[x + state & 0x1FFFF] + y & 0x1FFFF] + z & 0x1FFFF] + w & 0x1FFFF] + u & 0x1FFFF] + v & 0x1FFFF] ^ state;
072    }
073}
